lines.text: Cooler object gains, warmer object loses energy

secText:
Lesson:
1. Define [OBJ:expsec_k484:conduction]. Determine why conduction occurs.
2. Determine the factors required to calculate the [OBJ:expsec_k485:rate of conduction].
3. Calculate the [OBJ:expsec_k490:rate of conduction].
4. Define [OBJ:expsec_k486:convection] and identify examples of convection.
5. Define [OBJ:expsec_k4872331:electromagnetic radiation] and identify examples of electromagnetic radiation.
6. Determine how electromagnetic radiation can be turned into [OBJ:expsec_k488:solar power].
7. Determine the effects of [OBJ:expsec_k489:global warming].
8. [OBJ:expsec_k48722:Compare and contrast] conduction, convection, and radiation.
